questions.question: What is the purpose of the JOIN clause in SQL?
options: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column
questions.answer: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column

questions.question: Which SQL statement is used to delete data from a database?
Which of the following statements will return the unique values from a column?
What will the following SQL statement return: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM table_name?
options: Total number of rows in the table
Total number of columns in the table
Total number of unique values in the table
Total number of null values in the table
questions.answer: Total number of rows in the table

questions.question: Which SQL function is used to calculate the average value?
What is a primary key?
options: A unique identifier for a record in a table
A field that allows null values
questions.answer: A unique identifier for a record in a table

questions.question: What does the GROUP BY clause do?
options: Groups rows that have the same values in specified columns
questions.answer: Groups rows that have the same values in specified columns

questions.question: Which command is used to create a new database?
What is the difference between UNION and UNION ALL?
options: UNION removes duplicate records, UNION ALL retains them
UNION retains duplicate records, UNION ALL removes them
UNION is used for joins, UNION ALL is used for subqueries
questions.answer: UNION removes duplicate records, UNION ALL retains them

questions.question: Which of the following is used to set the access level of a database?
What does DBMS stand for?
Which of the following is a type of DBMS?
What is normalization?
options: A way to back up data

questions.question: What does ACID stand for?
What is a foreign key?
options: A primary key from another table
A unique identifier for a record
A key that allows null values
questions.answer: A primary key from another table

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a relational DBMS?
What is denormalization?
options: The process of combining tables to improve performance
The process of splitting tables to reduce redundancy
The process of backing up data
questions.answer: The process of combining tables to improve performance

questions.question: What is a data warehouse?
options: A system used for reporting and data analysis
A place to store backup data
questions.answer: A system used for reporting and data analysis

questions.question: Which type of DBMS uses a tree structure for data storage?
What is the purpose of an index in a database?
What does OOP stand for?
Which of the following is not a core concept of OOP?
What is encapsulation?
options: The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data
The ability to create new classes based on existing classes
The ability to take on many forms
questions.answer: The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data

questions.question: What is polymorphism?
options: The ability to present the same interface for different data types
The process of hiding the internal state of an object
The ability to derive new classes from existing ones
questions.answer: The ability to present the same interface for different data types

questions.question: Which of the following keywords is used to inherit a class in C++?
What is an abstract class?
options: A class that cannot be instantiated
A class that can be instantiated
A class that has no methods
questions.answer: A class that cannot be instantiated

questions.question: What is method overriding?
options: Defining a method in a derived class with the same name and signature as in the base class
Defining multiple methods in a class with the same name but different parameters
Changing the access modifier of a method
questions.answer: Defining a method in a derived class with the same name and signature as in the base class

questions.question: What is the purpose of a constructor?
What is the difference between an interface and an abstract class?
options: An interface cannot have any implementation, while an abstract class can have some
An interface can have a constructor, while an abstract class cannot
An abstract class cannot have methods, while an interface can
questions.answer: An interface cannot have any implementation, while an abstract class can have some

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using OOP?
What is a stack?
options: A linear data structure that follows the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle
A linear data structure that follows the First In First Out (FIFO) principle
questions.answer: A linear data structure that follows the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle

questions.question: What is a queue?
options: A linear data structure that follows the First In First Out (FIFO) principle
A linear data structure that follows the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle
questions.answer: A linear data structure that follows the First In First Out (FIFO) principle

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of linked list?
What is a binary tree?
options: A tree data structure where each node has at most two children
A tree data structure where each node has more than two children
questions.answer: A tree data structure where each node has at most two children

questions.question: What is the time complexity of searching in a balanced binary search tree?
What is the main advantage of using a hash table?
What is a graph?
options: A collection of nodes and edges
questions.answer: A collection of nodes and edges

questions.question: Which of the following sorting algorithms has the best average-case time complexity?
What is a deque?
What is the space complexity of an array?
What does TCP stand for?
Which of the following is a network protocol?
What is the function of a router?
options: To connect different networks and route packets of data
To connect devices within a network
questions.answer: To connect different networks and route packets of data

questions.question: What is an IP address?
options: A unique identifier for a device on a network
questions.answer: A unique identifier for a device on a network

questions.question: What does DNS stand for?
What is a subnet?
options: A logical subdivision of an IP network
questions.answer: A logical subdivision of an IP network

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model does TCP operate on?
What is the purpose of a firewall?
options: To protect a network from unauthorized access
To connect devices within a network
questions.answer: To protect a network from unauthorized access

questions.question: What is the main function of the transport layer in the OSI model?
options: To provide reliable data transfer between hosts
questions.answer: To provide reliable data transfer between hosts

questions.question: What is an SSL certificate used for?
options: To secure data transmission over the internet
To identify the sender of an email
questions.answer: To secure data transmission over the internet
